result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D. Hirman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven D. Hirman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven D. Hirman was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D. Hirman

records.addlTxt: 4:07  Defendant Steven D. Hirman not in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance by the defendant and based on his non appearance the court denies the motion to appoint counsel for his post conviction hearing. 4:08
Hearing on June 19, 2018 at 03:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

9:00 a.m. Defendant Steven D. Hirman in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - State would move to dismiss Counts 1, 2 and 4.  Defendant would plead guilty to Count 3, fine and DNA surcharge, $443.00.  Would meet with Prescott P.D. by January 10, 2018 to resolve the ownership of tools and equipment.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 3.      Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 3.  Court dismisses Counts 1, 2 and 4.  Court orders fine in the amount of $443, includes DNA sample and surcharge. 6 months to pay.   Appeal rights are given.  9:10 a.m.

11:12  Defendant Steven D. Hirman in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Froelich addresses the court. His witness Officer Jesse Neely is not present. Atty Petros states that this was already reset several times. Judge states this can be heard during the jury trial - property that is in dispute.  The property that is not in dispute can be returned to him.

for Return of Property Pursuant to Wisc. Stat. 968.20

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.   Defendant enters not guilty pleas to all counts at preliminary hearing.   Not guilty pleas received by the court.   Pretrial Conference to be set.

02:39 Defendant Steven D. Hirman in court with attorney Andrew M. Irlbeck.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
filed by Atty Irlbeck
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

2:21 Defendant Steven D. Hirman in court with Attorney Paul Applebaum.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties agree to reschedule preliminary hearing. No objection by defendant to going past 20 day time limit for preliminary hearings. Set for preliminary 4/21/16 at 2:15 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: 3:39 Defendant Steven D. Hirman in court, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lars Loberg appeared in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint . Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $3000 signature bond. Loberg has no objection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
